titleStmt.title: Planes apokalypsis. Popery manifested, or, the Papist incognito made known by way of dialogue betwixt a Papist priest, Protestant gentleman, and Presbyterian divine. In two parts. Intended for the good of those that shall read it by L. B. P.
titleStmt.author: Beaulieu, Luke, 1644 or 5-1723.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Henry Brome, at the Gun at the west end of S. Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Part 2 has a caption title: Popery manifested, and the Papist incognito made known. With separate pagination and continuous register.
The first two words of the title transliterated from the Greek.
The words "Papist" to "divine" are connected by a left brace.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, England.

place.placeName: the Gun at the west end of S. Pauls
